meanings.definition: To evaluate or assess (something) in a new or different way.
meanings.sent1: She decided to transvaluate her old paintings to see them in a fresh light.
meanings.sent2: It is important to transvaluate your study habits to improve your grades.
meanings.sent3: John tried to transvaluate his cooking skills, but ended up burning the dinner.
meanings.sent4: The artist transvaluated reality in his abstract paintings, creating a new perspective.
meanings.sent5: Transvaluating your goals can lead to unexpected opportunities and growth.

meanings.definition: To reevaluate or reconsider the value or worth of (something).
meanings.sent1: After the feedback, she had to transvaluate the importance of teamwork.
meanings.sent2: It's wise to transvaluate your investments regularly to ensure financial stability.
meanings.sent3: The cat transvaluated the value of the empty box, deciding it was the best toy.
meanings.sent4: She transvaluated her friendships, realizing true friends are priceless treasures.
meanings.sent5: Transvaluating your priorities can lead to a more fulfilling life.
